intro: Crotalaria kwengeensis, commonly known as the Kwenge sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant produces distinctive yellow flowers with prominent violet veins, typically arranged in racemes. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Crotalaria kwengeensis is often found in dry savannahs and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
